The Pacific Ocean is larger than the Atlantic.
The Suez Canal connects the Red Sea and the Indian Ocean.
The source of the Nile River is in Egypt.
The Amazon River is the longest river in the Americas.
Lake Baikal is the world\'s oldest and deepest freshwater lake.
Honolulu means big harbor.
The United States would fit 3-1/2 times into the continent of Africa.
Ionian and Cyclades are Greek islands.
Zagrebia is the capital of Croatia.
San Juan means rich port in Spanish.
Phillipines is spelled correctly.
Drumlins and eskers are formed by glaciers.
The International Date Line is an imaginary line that follows the 180 degree meridian through the Atlantic Ocean.
Baghdad is the capital of Iraq.
Loch Ness is the deepest Scottish Loch.
Mt. Mitchell is the highest mountain in the Appalachian range.
The Amur River is located in Egypt.
The basic unit of currency in Haiti is the Gourde.
Spain and France occupy the Iberian Peninsular.
Luxemborg is spelled correctly.

Rod Hull is associated with Emu.
Elton John and Sonny Bono called themselves Sharon and Phyllis.

9% of divorced couples still have sex together.

Sean Connery once worked as a coffin polisher.
The Surrey town of Epsom is famous for its soap.
Clark Gable was the inspiration for Bugs Bunny.
Kim Bassinger was sued for not acting in Boxing Helena.
Fort Knox, located in Texas, is the location of the USA\'s gold reserves.
Princess Diana\'s maiden name was Spencer.
The Friendship Bridge connects Nepal to Bangladesh.
James Dean died of an overdose.
Picasso painted the most paintings of all famous artists.
A person from Manchester is called a Mancunion.
Football player, Eric Cantona, drop kicked a fan at Crystal Palace.
Argentina owns Easter Island.
Mike Tyson was born in Brooklyn.
Chablis is typically white.
An eggplant is an Aubergine.
Couscous means cooked twice.
Boston butt and jowl are parts of a cow.
Sangria is a combination of fruit juice and wine.
Potato is the main ingredient in rosti.
Gin was invented in Geneva.
A tayberry is a cross between a blackberry and a raspberry.
Artichokes come in Globe and Jerusalem varieties.
Ghee is the liquid butter made from cow or buffalo milk.
In Russia, a pancake is called a blintze or blini.
You use more calories eating carrots than you gain.
The cocktail, Stinger, is made with Creme de Menthe and brandy.
The sandwich was named after the Earl of Sandwich.
A person with refined taste in food and drink is an epicure.
Lepidopttery, butterfly collecting, is spelled correctly.
If you were served pesce martello in Italy, you would be eating mussels.
Forks were originally called splitspoons.
The Chinese dish Chop Suey means Odds & Ends.
The Pentagon accidentally ordered an 82 year supply of freeze dried tuna salad mix.
The number 69 in Roman numerals is LXIX.
The Rosetta Stone was found in Italy.
Harvard is the oldest college in the world.
Frosty the Snowman\'s eyes were made out of buttons.
Cleopatra was Queen of Egypt and mistress to Julius Caesar.
Fidel Castro became premiere of Cuba in 1959.
Marie Curie discovered the cure for smallpox in 1796.
Julius Caesar was stabbed by Gaius Cassius Longinus.
Button Gwinnett was the first person to sign the Declaration of Independence.
Sophia Loren graced the cover of the first Playboy magazine in 1953.
Captain Cook discovered Christmas Island on Christmas Eve 1777.
Smallpox killed more than 1 billion people in 1979.
The French Revolution began in 1779.
Martin Luther King was assassinated in Memphis in 1969.
Woodstock Festival was held at Max Yasgur\'s dairy farm in New York in august of 1969.
According to the Bible, baby Jesus\' first visitors were three kings.
Susan B. Anthony, American feminist, is on the silver dollar.
Mark David Chapman was famous for shooting John Lennon in 1980.
The Easter lily is a native plant of China.
Queen Anne Boleyn had an extra finger.
-459.7 F is known as absolute Zero.
Tin Tin\'s canine companion was Snowy.
A Pitcher Plant is not carnivorous.
An animal\'s pouch is called a marsupial.
The human uterus expands 500 times its normal size during pregnancy.
The initials E.E.G. stand for Electroectocardiogram.
Since house cats\' coats are dry and glossy, their fur is easily charged with electricity.
The alloy pewter is made from tin and copper.
The square root of 144 is 12.
A shrimp prawn is born a male and evolves to a female as it matures.
Most varieties of snakes can go 2 years without eating any food.
Hawkers, Clubtails, Biddies, Emeralds, Darts & Skimmers are all birds.
Hepatitis affects the liver.
Nitrogen is the most reactive element.
Venus and Mercury are the only two planets with no moons.
Acetylsalicycil Acid (aspirin) is spelled correctly.
A sirocco refers to a type of wind.
A flock of geese is a gaggle. A group of kangaroos is a coop.
The blubber of a male elephant seal is used for lubricating machinery.
The \'c\' in e=mc^2 stands for the speed of light.
The Heisman trophy is awarded in American football.
There are 15 balls on a pool table at the start of a game.
If you were drinking castle beer, you would be in Ireland.
Michael Chang is an American tennis player.
Cross country skiing and shooting are events in a Biathlon.
In swimming, one might helicopter to the Bugaboos.
In 10 pin bowling, a perfect game consists of 280 points.
Salopettes are snow proof dungaree trousers.
Paramount Pictures logo has 22 stars in it.
Muhammad Ali was the youngest ever world heavyweight boxing champion.
The World Cup was first won by Brazil.
The Olympic sport of boxing prohibits the wearing of a beard.
In 1926, Gertrude Ederle was the first woman to swim the English Channel.
The Queens Park Rangers are the only English football league club beginning with the letter Q.
The minimum age a player can join the Seniors Golf Tour is 55.
The letters ERA in baseball stand for Earned Run Average.
In the card game Canasta, the object is to meld sets of 5 or more cards.
The fastest swimming stroke is the crawl.
Six Nightmare on Elm Street movies were made in the 80\'s.
Fedora, bowler and boater are all types of hats.
Love Me Do was the Beatles first hit single.
The French Horn and English Horn are in the key of G.
MP3 stands for multimedia player 3rd edition.
Pat Benatar recorded \'Shadows of the Night\' in 1981.
TLC released the album Crazy Sexy Cool.
Rap artist 50 Cent has his own video game.
The sound holes on violins resemble the letter \'V\'.
The Chanter is the melody pipe played with two hands on a bagpipe.
The Pretenders released their first LP in 1981.
Ozzy Osbourne contracted rabies after biting the head off a live bat.
Ray Charles\' last name is Robinson.
Didgeridoo, an Australian instrument, is spelled correctly.
Allegro is the root word of allergic.
Michael Jackson\'s hit song Ben was originally intended for Donny Osmond.
Paul McCartney\'s first name is James.
Britney Spear\'s debut single was Toxic.
A musical scale comprises 8 notes.
The longest running musical in Broadway history is The Music Man.
You can tell that someone is faking playing the clarinet if their right hand is positioned at the top.
Eminem\'s most controversial song was Bully.
McDowell killed MacBeth.
Sherlock Holmes resides at 221B Baker Street, London.
The artist Botticelli\'s name literally means Little Barrel.
The Goblet of Fire is the 3rd book in the Harry Potter series.
Ann Rand wrote a vampire series featuring Lestat.
Expialidocious is spelled correctly.
Charles Dickens is the author of Great Expectations.
A traditional artist\'s palette has two holes.
Orson Scott Card wrote Ender\'s Game.
Jean Paul Sarte rejected the Nobel Prize for literature in 1964.
Jane Austen\'s novel, Persuasion, was published posthumously.
Van Gogh painted the Mona Lisa.
Captain Hook, Tigress and Tinker Bell are all characters in Peter Pan.
Shakespeare\'s first name was Henry.
The term Impressionism was first used in conjunction with Claude Monet.
Mrs. William Heelis is better known as Beatrix Potter.
Homer Simpson wrote the poem the Iliad and the Odyssey.
Steven Spielberg wrote the novel Jaws.
Quotations from the Works of Chariman mao Tse-Tung is the 2nd best selling book of all time.
James Matthew Barrie\'s most famous character is Winnie the Pooh.
Genre painting is a realistic style in which every day life forms are the subject matter.
GAME OVER
LEVEL COMPLETED!!
GAME PLAY
Playing the Game
Pressing the PLAY button begins a new game.
You will immediately start with the first activity. Each activity presented may be in the form of a question, a statement or a word that you must determine if it is spelled correctly.
Tap the TRUTH button if you believe the answer is true.
Tap the TALE button if you believe the answer is false.
Watch out for the TIMER! Each level allows for a specific amount of time.
Advancing and Leveling Up
Complete an activity before the timer runs out and you will automatically advance to the next activity.

Run out of time before you complete any one of the activities in a given level and you start that level over from the beginning. All progress from that level will be lost. Complete all activities in a level without running out of time or answering incorrectly and you will advance to the next level. As the levels increase, your time for each activity will decrease. Also note that quitting the game without completing a level will erase your progress for that level.
About Truth or Tale

At Truth or Tale, our goal is to create a fun, educational experience for you to enjoy with minimal distractions from the outside world. We value your time as much as you do. That is why you will not be bombarded by pop-ups asking you to rate or share us, or annoying ads that impede your progress in learning as much trivia as possible. If you love us, please tell others. Word of mouth is still the best form of advertising. For now, we are keeping it simple. Relax, enjoy and escape with Truth or Tale.
App version 1.0
